rawData.title: James Meek · Computers that want things
rawData.summary: An exploration of artificial intelligence's lack of genuine desires and motivations, centered around the historic 2016 Go match between Lee Sedol and AlphaGo, and the philosophical implications for developing artificial general intelligence (AGI) with genuine wants and ethics.

rawData.title: TAG Heuer's New Smartwatch Ditches Google's Wear OS to Be Apple Friendly
rawData.summary: TAG Heuer's new Connected Calibre E5 smartwatch abandons Google's Wear OS for a proprietary operating system, making it compatible with both iPhones and Android devices, though it lacks access to major app stores.

rawData.title: Tristan Thompson on AI, Sports & Startups at Disrupt 2025 | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Former NBA champion Tristan Thompson will speak at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 about his ventures in AI sports analytics and tech entrepreneurship, including his company TracyAI which uses artificial intelligence for sports performance insights.

rawData.title: Google launches extensions system for its command-line coding tool | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Google launched Gemini CLI Extensions, allowing third-party companies to integrate with its command-line AI system through open-source extensions hosted on Github, with initial partners including Figma and Stripe.

rawData.title: This Moto Phone Has a Headphone Jack, MicroSD Slot, and Wireless Charging—and It's on Sale for $200
rawData.summary: The Motorola Moto G Power 5G 2025 smartphone offers rare features like a headphone jack, microSD slot, and wireless charging, along with a 5,000-mAh battery that lasts two days, now available for $200 during Amazon's sale.

rawData.title: SoftBank makes a $5.4 billion bet on AI robots
rawData.summary: SoftBank is acquiring ABB's robotics division for $5.4 billion as part of its strategic push into 'Physical AI' and robotics, marking one of four key investment areas alongside chips, data centers, and generative AI.

rawData.title: Our favorite batteries and chargers are on sale for October Prime Day
rawData.summary: Various charging accessories from major brands like Anker, Belkin, and Ugreen are discounted during Amazon's Prime Big Deal Days, including power banks, multi-port chargers, and wireless charging stations compatible with both iPhone and newer Android devices.

rawData.title: The AirPods 4 are just $89, matching their best price to date during October Prime Day
rawData.summary: Apple's AirPods 4 are on sale for an all-time low of $89 (normally $129) during Amazon's Prime Day, with the ANC version available for $119, offering improved sound quality and features like Voice Isolation compared to previous entry-level models.

rawData.title: Google's Search Live comes to India, AI Mode gets more languages | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Google is launching its AI-powered Search Live feature in India with English and Hindi support, while expanding AI Mode to seven additional Indian languages. India becomes the second market after the US to receive Search Live, which allows users to point their phone cameras at objects for real-time AI assistance and conversations.

rawData.title: OpenAI wasn’t expecting Sora’s copyright drama
rawData.summary: OpenAI is reversing its copyright policy for Sora after unexpected backlash, with CEO Sam Altman acknowledging they need to give rightsholders more control over how their characters and likenesses are used in AI-generated videos.

rawData.title: Amazfit’s Active 2, one of our favorite fitness trackers, is a steal at just $81
rawData.summary: The Amazfit Active 2 fitness tracker is on sale for $81 during Amazon's Prime Day, offering features like offline maps, heart rate monitoring, and AI assistance in a budget-friendly package that typically costs twice as much.

rawData.title: Samsung’s tiny AI model beats giant reasoning LLMs
rawData.summary: Samsung researchers demonstrated that a small neural network can outperform large language models in complex reasoning tasks, challenging the assumption that bigger models are always better.

rawData.title: HMD’s Touch 4G is a dumb-smart-phone
rawData.summary: HMD has launched the Touch 4G, a hybrid device that combines feature phone simplicity with smartphone capabilities like touchscreen and video calling, priced at ₹4,999 ($55) in India and running on a custom RTOS Touch operating system.

rawData.title: Firefox is adding profiles to separate your browsing sessions
rawData.summary: Mozilla Firefox is introducing profile management that allows users to create separate browsing spaces with distinct bookmarks, logins, history, extensions, and themes, rolling out from October 14th.

rawData.title: The 16 October Prime Day deals that are most popular with Verge readers
rawData.summary: The Verge reports on the most popular items purchased by their readers during Amazon's October Prime Day, including power banks, AirTags, USB-C cables, and electric screwdrivers, with deals running until Thursday.

rawData.title: Tuned Global strengthens its leadership in music technology with the acquisition of Figaro.ai
rawData.summary: Music technology platform Tuned Global has acquired Figaro.ai, a London-based AI company, to enhance its music industry technology offerings and continue supporting existing Figaro.ai customers.

rawData.title: Nothing Ear 3 review: work in progress
rawData.summary: Nothing's Ear 3 wireless earbuds ($179) feature a novel 'Super Mic' system built into the charging case for improved call quality, though its performance is inconsistent and faces compatibility limitations with some apps.

rawData.title: The 207 best October Prime Day deals you can still get
rawData.summary: Amazon's October Prime Day sale enters its final day with deals on tech products including headphones, TVs, smartwatches, and other gadgets available until Thursday 3AM ET.

rawData.title: AI Redaction That Puts Privacy First: CaseGuard Studio Leading The Way
rawData.summary: CaseGuard Studio has developed an AI-powered redaction platform that achieves 98% accuracy in automated data protection, targeting sectors like law enforcement, healthcare, legal, and financial services.

rawData.title: We dug through thousands of Prime Day deals to find 60 standouts for $50 or less
